abstract: The Senate voted to move forward with trade legislation that would impose tariffs on some Chinese goods to punish Beijing for keeping its currency artificially depressed.
snippet: The Senate voted to move forward with trade legislation that would impose tariffs on some Chinese goods to punish Beijing for keeping its currency artificially depressed.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Senate, seizing on the argument that the American jobs crisis is partly China’s fault, voted Monday to move forward with tough trade legislation that would impose tariffs on some Chinese goods to punish Beijing for keeping its currency artificially depressed.

headline.main: U.S. Senate Backs Tough China Trade Moves
headline.print_headline: Senate Proposes Punishing China for Low Currency Value

byline.original: By Jennifer Steinhauer and Mark Landler
